intro: Tryphostemma niloticum, commonly known as the Nile waterleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found near water bodies. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and wetland areas.
